evidence: linear systems are manageable to study, yet powerful in their applications
two key properties must hold: additivity and homogeneity
we’ll be ready to tackle the greater complexity of nonlinear systems
we concentrate on linear systems-the simplest and most important class of systems, especially in medical imaging.
In a linear system, two key properties must hold: additivity and homogeneity.
Together, these form the superposition principle.
